meanings.definition: Captivating or striking in appearance or effect.
meanings.sent1: The movie had an arresting plot that kept me glued to my seat.
meanings.sent2: Her arresting beauty made everyone turn their heads as she entered the room.
meanings.sent3: The arresting sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent4: The artist's arresting brush strokes brought the painting to life.
meanings.sent5: The magician's performance was so arresting that the audience couldn't look away.

meanings.definition: To stop or check the progress of something.
meanings.sent1: The police officer had to arrest the speeding car to prevent an accident.
meanings.sent2: He quickly moved to arrest the spread of rumors before they caused more harm.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to arrest the noisy classroom to regain control.
meanings.sent4: The new security measures helped to arrest the increase in thefts in the area.
meanings.sent5: The timely intervention managed to arrest the decline in sales for the company.

meanings.definition: To seize and take into custody by legal authority.
meanings.sent1: The police were able to arrest the suspect without any resistance.
meanings.sent2: The detectives worked tirelessly to arrest the criminal responsible for the theft.
meanings.sent3: The cat burglar was finally arrested after a daring heist.
meanings.sent4: The undercover operation led to the arrest of the drug traffickers.
meanings.sent5: The sheriff's deputies moved in to arrest the fugitive hiding in the woods.
